p: These findings reveal important, but often veiled complexity in the strategies that address power asymmetries in co-production processes concerning SDGs. Aspects related to issues of power and climate change intersect, we argue, with epistemological (forms of knowing or understanding) and ontological (forms of being or existing) differences, where ways of knowing climate change and ways of being in the world manifest as different understandings of power, culture, science, and technology.
